Author: makebelievethighs
Text: you'll tell your therapist when you're ready. healing isn't a linear process. you're not wasting anyone's time - your journey is your own, and progress looks different for everyone, and can look different day by day. try going consistently and lowering the expectation that you need to be revealing your depths every time. if they are at all good, your therapist will move at your pace.

Author: Braseford
Text: If you’re worried about your parents finding out - your therapist has an obligation to remain secretive. It doesn’t matter that your parents pay for your therapy.   Your therapist will be able to help you better if you tell them. Or able to point you to a trusted colleague or institution to help you if they are not qualified to help with an ED - it tends to be a specialty on its own.
